page.title: 04NAIRN SHOPKEEPER'S THOUGHTS
page.content: A number of local shopkeepers interviewed felt that the opening of the modern shopping centre in{ {Inverness}had badly affected their trade.Only one shopkeeper felt he had benefited from the trade attracted by the new{Templetons}supermarket.His shop dealt in televisions,videos etc. and he said that the personal guaranteed service he offered allowed him to compete with the larger electrical stores. Several shopkeepers blamed the {rising rates}for the closing shops although some admitted that the rise in rates was in line with inflation.One shopkeeper felt however that little could be done to attract trade back to{Nairn}because peoples shopping habits have changed and as long as they could afford to travel the larger centres would gain.
